Fields.DialogueText: *whistles*
... No, that's not it.
What’s not it?
Kanchou! I was just trying to perfect my isobue - my whistling. The ama divers I’ve met seemed amused that I’d want to learn how... but their sea whistle is such a unique sound.

Fields.MenuText: But you aren’t exactly an ama, Hachi. Are you sure they gave you the secret to the technique?
I’d help you if I could, but I wouldn’t know the difference between a proper-sounding isobue and the Colonel Bogey March. Sorry.
So is the the satisfying *glub-glub* a Morgana makes as she fills with water and goes down.

Fields.DialogueText: I’m quite sure, Kanchou. The ama deeply respect kami, even one as young as I am. I felt they were pleased that I asked, actually.
It’s I that should apologize, Kanchou. This is my project; I didn’t mean to look so in need of help.
A sound only a Kami of the Fleet like me can make them produce, it’s true. I also know that by making them produce that... sound, I ensure the ama may continue to isobue. Still...
You’ll have to call it to my attention the next time we hear the real thing. Any idea why you’re having trouble?
I think it’s my breathing technique. They can hold their breath for only about two minutes...
"Only?"
... I can stay submerged for 20 hours at a time.
Good point.
... Kanchou, our scouts have just detected a surface slick.
From Morgana mist?
I believe so.
Pass the coordinates on to our navigator, Hachi. Looks like it’s time to make some Morgana noisy.
Hai!
@BATTLE
Okay, Hachi, ask the question.
Kanchou?
You’d ordinarily be the last Belle I'd expect to get distracted on a mission. So, what’s on your mind?
... Katsuo, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Gesundheit.
The fish? You'd like us to slow down so you can make a catch, I take it?
You and your pelagic-to-plate... So, how much time are we talking about here?

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry. Couldn't help myself.
... If it isn't too much trouble.
Is that so?
Well.... The cooks did note we could use more fish stock...
As much as I’d like to give you the chance to fish, there’s a fleet behind us, sweating bullets.
I understand. This is a task I was built for and I’m glad to again be at work that doesn’t involve delivering coffee or describing my encounters with Injustice.  Still...
*sigh* I think the last of the crew you called “gun-shy” were finally appreciating sashimi. I see this as a setback, Kanchou.
Patience, Hachi, it’s not a race. That said, it sounds like when this is over we need to budget a couple of hours for a fishing trip before our next mission.
While I appreciate the thought, we are still in this mission... which just became validated. I detect Funayūrei.
@BATTLE
Is it getting a little hotter than usual down here, or is it just me?
They're almost in range, Kanchou.
I'm glad to hear it. By all rights they should've beaten us to Kakeromajima - you made good time.
I was feeling inspired, I suppose.
@BATTLE
It’s hotter, Kanchou. We’re up to 38 degrees centigrade.
What! Why?
The cooling unit is offline.
... And why is that?
Engineering has been trying to determine the cause since we were brought down from Battle Stations status.
Radio, notify the Fleet that we’re making a detour to Hiroshima.
Hai!
But...! Kanchou, does an issue with extra heat really warrant it? I’m sure Engineering will have it taken care of soon.

Fields.MenuText: It’s not like you to worry about reasons for a side trip, Hachi. Things break; it’s not a reflection on you.
If I haven’t been told about it until now, Hachi, I don’t expect to hear what the problem is for a while, much less how to fix it.
And I’m sure Engineering will have it taken care of that much faster with dockside assistance. Right?

Fields.DialogueText: I don’t like to waste time on things my own crew can deal with, Kanchou. I’m sure it will be resolved before we arrive, meaning our detour will be nothing but a waste of time and fuel.
... So desu. Still...
I don’t understand why you are so concerned about it, Kanchou.
We’re still sitting on the surface, Hachi.
If we have to crash dive and hide out for any length of time... between the heat and humidity, we could end up at a high alert level in literally a couple of rocks short of a sauna. For hours.
The crew is strong enough; they can endure such conditions.
I know they're strong - which is why I don’t see the need for them to prove how much they can endure until it’s necessary. Besides, a stitch in time saves nine, right?
... So desu, Kanchou.
The Rice-abounding Land of Reed Plains/Is a land where things fall out/As will the gods, without lifted words of men/Yet must I lift up words: "Be fortunate, and travel safe and sound!"
If you be free from evils/Then shall we meet once more/So I lift up words over and over again/As the waves roll a hundredfold, a thousandfold!
I like it.
I’m pleased, Kanchou. It’s from the Manyōshū: the Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves.
That’s a lot of leaves.
Some of the poems in the collection were already ancient when it was collected... a body of work to last ten thousand ages.
It is from such a venerable work that I finally have come to understand something of myself.
Oh? What's that?
My home is a land where matters fall as the gods will them. The Yamato people do not regularly beseech the gods for blessings, but offer thanks and homage for those that are given.
Therefore, it is the will of the gods that has placed me in your care, Kanchou... no matter how odd your ways of thinking are to me from time to time...
I suspect the gods get more requests you think... and I could be a heartless tyrant, but since you’ve been forced to choose me because of them, that’s okay?

Fields.MenuText: If you’re right, it sounds rude to put a kami in that kind of situation without giving her an advanced warning.
If that’s true, doesn’t that make the Morganas showing up “as the gods will," too?
It sounds like a convenient way to pass the buck, if you ask me.

Fields.DialogueText: That too, is as the gods will.
... It is possible the gods have given the Funayūrei their power. It is possible they have taken power for their own. I don’t know.
What I do know is that it takes a strong desire for vengeance and destruction on their part that make them onryō of the sea.
In other words, the Morganas have enough agency to become the monsters they are, but the Belles who fight them must dance to whatever the tune played.
I don’t understand why the explanation bothers you so much, Kanchou.
Because I believe you have more latitude than you give yourself credit for, Hachi.
That logic also bothers me. It’s a short stretch to becoming sink ‘em ALL and let the gods sort ‘em out.
...I have just detected a Funayūrei, Kanchou.
It is my will to catch and sink her.
@BATTLE
Hutchinson, for some reason the Chief Warrant Officer sent me to see you.
Is this related to Hachi no Kami, Captain?
How did you know?
He assigned me as Enlisted Liaison to this vessel’s Kami... without merit, Captain.
This is news to me. Any reason why?
Does my captain desire the officer’s version or the enlisted?

Fields.MenuText: This is sounding better and better... Give me both, but I’ll take the enlisted one last. I love a good laugh.
There’s that big a difference?
The version I get to use to explain it to MY superiors.

Fields.DialogueText: Very well, Captain.
There is, Captain. Let me start with the officer’s version.
The officer’s version it is, then, Captain.

As a hydrophone specialist I’m trained to listen for important sounds others might miss. As a per diem radio translator I'm equipped to receive and transmit kotodama - words of power - when necessary.
Qualities he felt were useful for a liaison to a spirit.
Kotodama... that’s one way to look at orders. And the enlisted version?
I’m apparently easy to talk to...and Hachi no Kami looks old enough to be one of his daughters. The worry that he’ll slip up and browbeat an officer and a kami scares him silly.
Gotcha. So, speaking of Hachi, have you seen her?
Hachi no Kami wore herself out earlier.
Wore herself out?
I was on duty, so I could hear her swimming. She stopped before the change of the watch... I think she went to sleep, Captain.
We’ve been making way for hours, Petty Officer. ...At fleet speed.
Yes, Captain.
This isn’t the first time she has kept pace this way while I’ve been on watch, either, but... It’s rare for her to go at it for so long.
I see.
If it’ll put your mind at ease, from what I can tell she’s a very light-
Kanchou, we need to dive! Funayūrei!
@BATTLE
"To what shall I liken this life? It is like a boat, which, unmoored at morn, drops out of sight and leaves no trace behind."
Hachi?
My apologies, Kanchou. I have just been notified that potential funayūrei activity has been observed to the south-west of our current heading. Your orders?
*sigh* Can you start by defining what “potential funayūrei activity” means?
@BATTLE
Hachi.
Hachi, front and center, please.
HAI! Reporting as ordered, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: You really aren’t making this easy, are you?
I’m disappointed, Hachi. I know you can communicate with me better than that.
If that's the way you want it. You are dismissed, Hachi no Kami.

Fields.DialogueText: Gomenasai gozaimasu, Kanchou.
*winces*
... Hai.
*sigh* I’ll be here ready to listen when you’re ready to talk with me. Okay?
...Hai, Kanchou.
*whispering* Maintain heading and ready torpedoes. One of these days we'll finally sink a group of these things before they have a chance to try to get inside our heads.
@BATTLE
Has Hachi spoken to you, Petty Officer?
Only when necessary, Captain.
... Captain, it may not be my place to say this, but - the crew is starting to get worried.
About?
That the ship will lose her Kami, and she’ll go back to being a submarine without a Belle.

Fields.MenuText: Isn’t it a little soon to be panicking that much?
They think it’s become that serious, then.
Their lack of faith in their own ship is disappointing.

Fields.DialogueText: When every day is an adventure, it’s sometimes... difficult to gage how soon is *too* soon. Plus, HQ hasn’t issued us a manual on the proper care and maintenance of our Kami.
True, and I doubt they ever will. I hope you’re keeping notes, Petty Officer.
A few, Captain.
At this point, they see a ship and her captain not being in harmony with each other... so, yes, they believe it has, Captain
They’re used to seeing more evidence that she is around, especially when we’re on the surface. Her going from a fixture in our routine to a shadow this fast has some sailors unnerved, Captain.
Any advice you can give me?
My advice? Well, I have no idea why she’s gone so quiet in the first place. Do you?
She told me that I’m her captain because it’s as the gods will.
... And?
I told her I wasn’t going to let her off the hook that easily.
Captain? You told a kami that the will of the gods isn’t behind her?
... That’s not what I meant.
I have no doubt of that, Captain.
... But that is one way to interpret it, though.
*reading aloud* Be not hasty, however you long for home; go, watching well the winds, for rough is your way.
*She looks up in surprise, then blinks away to hide her book.*
Hachi?
You were looking for me, Kanchou?
I thought I heard you just now.
I’ve just come from below deck, Kanchou.
... Right. Have you found them yet?
Hai. They looked in good condition from what I could see.
Have you contacted the carrier group? I'm sure they'll be happy to get word of their downed crew.
I've signaled the basics. I’ll give them a full status report as soon as I know myself.
Very thoughtful of you, Hachi.
It’s common sense, Kanchou.
Common sense isn’t as common as you might think, Hachi.
... If you have no further questions for me, Kanchou...

Fields.MenuText: Clearly I’m not earning high marks in the trust-and-understanding department. Can you give me a hint about where I went wrong?
If it’s improper or unacceptable to outright tell me why you’re so hurt, could you do this apologetic captain a favor and speak to your enlisted liaison about it?
Do you plan to act this way for the rest of the war? Because at this rate it won’t be a long span, for either of us.

Fields.DialogueText: I do not believe in the middle of operations is the time for this discussion, Kanchou.
With all respect, Kanchou, I doubt she would be able to understand me any better than you do.
... Carry on.
What it it?
Funayūrei.  Abaft of port... Kanchou, she’s on course for the rescue point!
@BATTLE
Kanchou...
I see them.
It's not the Funayūrei that are close that bother me.
... We're being watched.
Oh, hell. Injustice?
I... think so.
Dammit. Right - one battle at a time.
@BATTLE
Well met, Hachi.
You aren’t going to die on me? Leave the surface? Don’t hold back on my account, Hachi. By all means, feel free to die for me.
If you don’t want to right now, that’s fine too. I won’t be long anyway, I just wanted to confirm for myself a most interesting rumor about you and your oni.
And to demonstrate you’re willing to sacrifice other Morganas to flush us out. I’m sure you’re eventually going to run out of dumb ones though, Injustice.
I hope that isn’t your opinion, Hachi. There is one fool born every minute, after all. I just cull the population a little.
I also wanted to show that following you to the ends of the earth to play with you was no exaggeration. Even after you hurt me... that wasn’t very nice, you know.

Fields.MenuText: Pot, meet Kettle.
If you want, just wait right there. Hachi can write you an apology letter and send it to you by carrier-torpedo.
You *really* like to hear yourself talk, don't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Did you hear something, Hachi?
You’re even back to giving me the silent treatment. Something you’ve been practicing, so I hear.
So be it, then. Since you won’t play with me, I’ll arrange for you to meet with other playmates instead.
To play with, or to play with?
I’m curious to learn that answer myself. Until we meet again: be well, Hachi.
Damn. I really hope that's the same ship we hoped we sank - if more Injustices are turning into... that... the war's going to get even more frustrating.
Hachi?
Sitting on pontoons may have kept them out of the water, but we shouldn’t leave those airmen adrift any longer than necessary, Kanchou. Just bring me in closer - and I'll need a tow-rope.
You've got it. Have a good swim.
*splish*
Your orders, Kanchou?
Double the spotters, give Hachi a hand, get whatever scouts we have available airborne again, and prepare for maximum speed. I’ll see find I can find another ship for the handoff.
We aren’t going to deliver the airmen directly home ourselves, Kanchou?
Not as soon as the Fleet hears about this...
Anything?
... Nothing.
You’re that worried she’ll set up residence in our wake again?
She? Ah, you mean Injustice. If she’s that eager for a repeat of the Red Sea...
Right. Then, if it isn’t her, what are you on the lookout for? You’re looking for something...
Just an inspection of my bow and net cutter.

Fields.MenuText: ... And? It looks like they’re still there.
I’ll leave you to your inspection, then. Not that you need it, but let me emphasize that the hatch to my quarters is always open.
If you’re doing an inspection, then I’ll expect a report.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, Kanchou. They are.
I will keep that in mind, Kanchou.
I will prepare one for you, Kanchou.
Right. If you'll excuse me...
*sigh* Nothing. I wonder if I need to be closer to home for better reception...
@BATTLE
*whistle*
No.
*whistle*
*Sigh.* That’s still not it.
Action stations, people! This is emphatically not a drill!
@BATTLE
Not for lack of trying, though.
I’m a little surprised you’re practicing in Morgana infested waters though, if Venom was any indication...
Injustice already knows where I am. What does it matter if others do, too? Let them come.
"What do I care for life and death/I who have come praying all the way/to the god of hail-spattering Kashima/and joined the Imperial host?"

Fields.MenuText: I prefer life to the alternative, myself. I’m a lot more effective that way.
I’m not questioning your courage, Hachi. You’re usually more interested in listening than calling out is all.
Absolutely. Let them come. But you’d better be prepared for what comes after that - the “Imperial host” has no place for the undisciplined, let alone the Protection Fleet.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, Kanchou. I understand.
So, is there any particular reason why ama whistle like that? Do you know?
... It is many things. It is a part of their traditional ways, a technique learned from ama before them and passed on to the ama they will teach.
It comes from the way they breathe in order to dive deep for as long as they do - they wouldn’t isobue if they weren’t ama.
... It also signifies to others she has successfully returned to the surface. Their methods are not easy work - if one gets trapped by a rock...
"Here I am. Don’t worry about me, my dive is over and I’m back on the surface."
"And as soon as I catch my breath and store my catch, I will start my next dive."
Of course. Well, I’ll let you get back to your practice. Don’t get discouraged though, Hachi, I’m sure you’ll get the hang of it.
Arigatō gozaimasu, Kanchou. You are too kind to me.
I don't think that's even a little bit true.
... I'll see you on the bridge, Hachi.
I swear, this library grows every week. I don't know what it is about Belles and books, but...
Where was it again...? Ah. This looks like the place.
So Hachi wasn’t kidding about the Manyōshū being twenty volumes. Let’s see... three, four... ten... sixteen...
*appears, carrying book*
Kanchou!
*hides book behind her back*
What are you - can I help you with something?
Hi, Hachi. And, no, that's okay.

Fields.MenuText: I'm just volunteering to help our librarian out for a few minutes.
I’m seeking enlightenment.
I'm just browsing. And lo and behold: we have the entire Manyōshū. ...Give or take.

Fields.DialogueText: ... If anyone's formally serving as librarian, it's me.
Well, that's convenient.
Enlightenment, Kanchou?
... That would appear to be the case, Kanchou.
And there really isn't anything that needs to be done here right now. Unless you need something...?
You said that it was through the poetry of the Manyōshū that you came to learn about yourself, so I thought I’d see if it could give me some insight.
Actually...
What about you, Hachi? Looking for something in particular?
I... wanted to make sure the books were in order. After particularly rough combat, they sometimes go adrift.
*ALARM*
... I'm never going to get these requisition forms finished. I see that now.
@BATTLE
Really? I didn’t know that. I’ll bring it to the attention of maintenance, then... I’m sure they’ll have ideas on how to make them more secure.
For now, though, everything looks in order.
That’s good to hear.
... We just entered a Fleet patrolled zone, Kanchou, so I think I will take the opportunity to rest.
Good idea. Since there’s no telling what Injustice meant by “other playmates,” grab all the sleep you can. We can keep the hatches battened down on our own for a little while.
Hai, Kanchou. Then, if you will excuse me...
Of course. Until next time.
... There. Back on the shelf where you belong.
*yawn*
Hmm...
Nice try, but I wasn’t born yesterday - and Hutchinson already accounted for every book...
... but one.
And here it is. Hmmm... a piece of her sash, too. Or train. Or whatever it is.
“I dreamed I was holding / A double-edged sword close to my body. / What does it foretell? It tells / That I shall meet you soon."
A bookmark?
Close. I can tell, I-8.
But where.... I can’t tell.
Injustice spoke of you... and... it would... appear that your reputation is... is warranted.
*whispering* We're missing something here. Is Injustice going out of her way to find these lucid Morganas? Getting us to sink them before they're alert enough to challenge her?
*whispering* Not the best time to wonder aloud, Kanchou...
*whispering* Point taken.
It may not make much sense to you, but... I am relieved to learn that.
I... I know that we are enemies, I-8. I know that when... IF, if... I find you, I would... shoot you... and strafe you, and drop bombs on you and ram you and-
*Sigh* ... Just as I’m sure that you are trying to get yourself in range to torpedo me. Perhaps that would even be for the best, but... I can’t let you destroy me.
But I don’t want to fight you, either. So... I know that we are enemies, but... can you please grant me this temporary stalemate and just remain, like this?
*whispering* Huh.
*whispering* It must be a trick, Kanchou. No Funayūrei would seek to avoid combat!

Fields.MenuText: *whispering* You’ve got good ears... can you tell if she’s lying or not?
*whispering* I’m not sure if it’s a good idea to paint all Morganas with the same brush, Hachi.
*whispering* Humor me, Hachi. If she’s telling the truth, we can hold her here long enough for the Fleet to find her.

Fields.DialogueText: *whispering* I have good hearing - I'm not a... Mackenzie-Lewis Polygraph.
*whispering* The only things I can confirm are that she’s a heavy cruiser and she’s named Despair, Kanchou.
*whispering* That’s like comparing you with Canarias. ...Or, wait, to Pola.
*whispering* ... Nürnberg? ... Never mind.
*whispering* And if she's not?
*whispering* We can play cat and mouse with the best of them, Hachi. There’s no reason we can’t stay on her wake for a while, the way Injustice did to us.
Oh, no.
*whispering* What now? Has something changed?
NoNOno... Don’t come this way... I... don’t...
*sob*
*whispering* Kanchou. To the west, there's a convoy... with escorts. None of them Kami of the Fleet.
...Me... Stop... Me... Please... Stop, me. *Sob* ...StopMeStopMe! STOPSTOPSTOP-
Go.
@BATTLE
*Hachi is practicing her iaido mental sharpening. She draws her sword in a blur, sheathes it, repeats.*
"There is true valor and false. To be incited by mere impetuosity to violent action cannot be called true valor."
*WOOSH*
"The soldier and the sailor should have sound discrimination of right and wrong, cultivate self-possession, and form their plans with deliberation."
*click*
"Never to despise an inferior enemy or fear a superior, but to do one’s duty as soldier or sailor - this is true valor."
*WOOSH*
"Those who thus appreciate true valor should in their daily intercourse set gentleness first and aim to win the love and esteem of others."
*click*
That’s not from the Manyōshū.
It’s not. It’s the Gunjin Chokuyu - The Imperial Precepts to the Soldiers and Sailors.
I’m aware of that. I’ve heard you recite more than just a few lines of the precept on valor, Hachi. I’ve heard you recite the whole thing from memory.
So which is she to you, Hachi - an inferior enemy or a superior? Despair, I mean.
Clearly she is not a superior one, since I do not fear her.

Fields.MenuText: You don't fear any Morgana, Hachi. Doesn't mean we'd enjoy a one-on-one above-water brawl with a Vanity.
No, but she has you rattled enough to return to the basics for answers.
I wouldn’t call Injustice an inferior one either, yet despicable pretty much sums up my opinion of her.

Fields.DialogueText: I should hope you remember the strengths of a submarine, Kanchou. That is part of forming one’s plans with deliberation and acting on them with self-possession, after all.
That one is truly an example of false valor, Kanchou; if you affect valor and act with violence, the world will in the end detest you and look upon you as a wild beast.
The funayūrei, one and all, are violent forces that bring ruin where they sail. Had Despair tried to surrender, I would have cut her down for being a wretched liar attempting to fool me.
However, she did not. She just...
Her anguish...
It was genuine.
Very much so. I know I do not feel contempt for her, Kanchou. ...But that is all I know.
And have you figured out what you want to do, should we cross paths with... some similar Despair? Another incarnation with the same mindset?
... It doesn’t matter right now. The Funayūrei I have just found isn’t her.
@BATTLE
Hachi? Are you asleep?
No, Kanchou! What are your orders?

Fields.MenuText: I’ll have a basket of fish and chips.
No orders, just a suggestion and a request.
At ease, Hachi, it’s nothing serious.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! I will return short-
I'm kidding!
I see.
... Very well, Kanchou.
We’ll be in Lisbon soon, for another round of debriefing - on Injustice, and very possibly on Despair. You should probably get some rest while you can.
I will take your suggestion to heart.
That said, could you return this book to the lending library for me? I’m planning on sending Hutchinson out to pick up personal copies of the Manyōshū.
I wanted to get down all the publishing details I could from the one we have on board.
Certainly, Kanchou. But... with a full set on board, isn’t that unnecessary? And our destination is Lisbon. I doubt she will find what you’re looking for so far from home.
The crew can always use more to read. And, this way, I can satisfy my need for verse at any time I want.
As for our destination, Hachi... you're hardly the only Japanese vessel touring the Atlantic coasts these days. You might be surprised what we can find.
Is that so...
Yup. Thanks for the help, Hachi. I have a stack of requisition forms that I increasingly urgently need to complete.
Then I will leave you to them, Kanchou. Excuse me.
*IN THE LIBRARY*
... What’s this? M-my bookmark? But this isn’t the volume I was reading earlier... and the pages it’s on...
“When I hear, though from far away / That you are bowed in grief / I can but weep aloud / I, your bosom friend.”
“You who know so well / How fleeting is our human life / Do not wear out your heart / You, a brave warrior!”
... Kanchou. Thank you.
@BATTLE
See, Hachi? What did I tell you? All twenty volumes.
I suppose I shouldn’t be so surprised, knowing who represents the Kami of the Fleet.
More like where enough people gather, you’ll find some enterprising merchant willing to provide a taste of home, no matter how far “home” may be.
The Portuguese provide not just “home,” Kanchou; they’ve been plying their wares to the Yamato people for centuries.
Not just to Japan, but I get the point.
... I will concede that I don’t starve when we are in Lisbon.
I noticed that runner you dispatched. What’s on the menu, caldeirada or bolo do caco with octopus?
... Pastéis de bacalhau.

Fields.MenuText: So the world might be worth saving for the food, hm?
I suppose that's a step in the right direction - although fish isn’t the only food in the world, you know.
I’ll remember that. Still open to food from any cook, or have you discovered *the* best chef in Lisbon yet?

Fields.DialogueText: There is more in life than just food, Kanchou.
I know. Just teasing you.
I know. But, as much as I want some, I have yet to find a chef here who prepares horsemeat sashimi.
Yes, well... you might have to wait until we’re closer to home for that one. But cooked? The world is a big place, Hachi.
Hutchinson introduced me to several fishers and fishmongers, so the runners have a good idea of who to avoid...
Fair enough.
By the way, you're free to borrow books from my personal collection too, if you choose. The Manyōshū or... well, anything else I have stashed away.
That’s not necessary, Kanchou.
But it's sincere, and I'm not backing down.
But I wouldn't want to take a volume you were still reading.
No worries. I just need to get a bookmark, is all.
You don’t have a bookmark? Then permit me to provide you with one. It’s the least I can do.
Deal. Since it’s you, I know you’ll keep it simple.
Hai, Kanchou! I won’t disappoint you!
@BATTLE
Here is the bookmark I promised, Kanchou.
Let’s see what you came up with...
Is this a tally? From a dress cap? Excellent idea!
It isn’t that impressive... I just thought a ribbon would be flat and quiet, Kanchou. That's all.
Quiet?
I’m... aware of noise, Kanchou. I first considered a braided cord with a dangling charm, but that would run the risk of hitting a surface when you set the book down.
You even thought that far.

Fields.MenuText: So, am I that noisy?
I’ll keep that in mind the next time you’re resting, Hachi.
And no one is going to be in trouble during the next dress inspection, I’m sure.

Fields.DialogueText: No, Kanchou! Not at all! Pay Injustice no mind, I am the greatest source of noise in our vicinity. Because of that, Kanchou, I do my best not to add to it.
You needn't worry about me, Kanchou. Long debriefings aside, I rarely require more than a “nap,” since I have little trouble finding time to be one with my hull.
Like the time the rest of us "solid" beings use to get around anywhere below deck?
Exactly, Kanchou.
If anyone proves to be negligent, Kanchou, it won't be because this one is missing. My sailors have told me that some navies have a tradition of trading them, so I keep a few extra for that purpose.
Kanchou? Sorry to interrupt, but there's a Fleet messenger at dockside for you.
Looks like you have great timing, Hachi - I'll see you soon. Lead the way, Mr. Nakamura.
“Since the age of the gods it has always been said/That the Land of Yamato is/A land where Sovereign-Gods hold solemn swayA land where the word-soul brings us weal...
“Not only has it been so told from mouth to mouth/But all of us see and know it now.”
“All the gods who rule the shores/And wide seas far away/At the prow will pilot you...
“And the gods of heaven and earth/And the 'Great-Land-Spirit' of Yamato/Will look down from the sky/As they soar through heaven.
“When you return, your duties done/The gods again, with their hands upon the prow/Will speed your journey home...
“Straight as the drawn ink-line/From Chika's cape to Ōtomo/Where your ships will harbour at Mitsu's shore.
"Be safe and well, my lord/Quickly come back home!”
Maybe you do understand, Kanchou. Still...
The gods again, with their hands upon the prow... I have to hope you are right. I looked for them at my prow, but I couldn’t find them.
@BATTLE
Hutchinson, what’s with the cardboard box? A puppet theater for the crew?
A paper play theater, Captain. It may be crude, but... art isn’t my strong suit.
Before I call in the crew... Captain, would you like to *cough* buy some sweets *cough*...

Fields.MenuText: And what sweets might I be able to purchase from you, my good storyteller?
Ah. I think I have some spare change...
Will the proceeds go towards a better setup?

Fields.DialogueText: Let me see... I have konpeitō... the galley provided me with fresh dorayaki... some sakuma drops...
*And for one brief, strange moment, the ship's whole array of background noises seem to come together in a purr.*
... Sakuma drops it is, then.
Wonderful, Captain! There you go... a dish of snacks, and a front-row seat.
That all depends on how well this one does, Captain.
I don’t want to... spoil my dinner. Just set it aside and give them to Hachi later for me.
Absolutely!
Fair enough. Since you don’t own the deck, I’ll pay your rent. I trust you can deliver it to her in the form of her favorite sweets...
You are too kind, Captain. And yes, I am familiar with the current cash-to-candy exchange rate.
So, what play are you going to perform?
Ryūjin and the dutiful ship, Sensuitei Dai-roku: the Submersible who became a Submarine. The stirring, bittersweet story of the first submarine built on Yamato soil.
The dragon-god of the sea - Ryūjin - accuses Submersible Number 6 of being both a trespasser to his domain and a thief, then tests her claim of being an underwater warship.
You said bittersweet.
The "test" is during a training dive, and while it happens in less than 60 feet of water she has no means for her crew to escape while she’s submerged.
The air eventually becomes too thin and they die. All fourteen are found still at their posts when she is raised, two days later.
... Did you just hear a sniffling sound?
Uh...
... So. Her commanding officer calmly leaves pages of notes on everything they try, ending with an apology to His Majesty, Emperor Meiji for losing the valuable craft and crew.
*sniffle* *sniffle*
... I hope that’s good enough for Ryūjin.
It is. A hard act to follow, isn’t she?
It is with great reluctance that I must cancel your performance, Petty Officer. I have detected nearby Funayūrei.
I think - Hachi? Everything okay?
Not canceled, Hachi, only postponed. I paid for a performance and I’m not letting the Petty Officer off the hook with just a synopsis.
I see. Postponed, then. For now, I will bring the crew to alert.
Thank you, Hachi.
... Be sure to have handkerchiefs available next time.
Extra absorbent ones, on the list.
@BATTLE
So, what did you think?
About Hutchinson's performance? She has her moments. Her *Don-don* and *Uwaa* are not bad. The pictures, though...
It might not have been museum-quality art, no... but the number of manly tears shed over that reclassification ceremony at the end made me glad she wasn’t performing below deck.
But that wasn't really what I was asking you about.
... As a fellow submarine, Dai-roku Sensuikan-sama is tiny next to me, but... the ripples of her wake are massive.
I suppose you’re right. She did set the bar pretty high.
Indeed.

Fields.MenuText: I have faith that you’re up to the standard she set, Hachi.
Physical size aside, It can’t have been easy for her to blaze the trail she left.
I get the sense there’s more to it than her just having a crew that gave their all, though.

Fields.DialogueText: I try, Kanchou. Sometimes I wonder if I can.
I suppose. Her example makes being a leader look easy... or maybe it came more naturally to her than me...
... She never saw combat, Kanchou, but... her personal valor is superior to mine.
Really?
How so?
If not for her, I might still be considered a type of marine boat with a quirky talent, instead of vessel class in my own right.
If there was ever any question how a submarine of the Empire of Japan should behave, her example stands as a spotless guide to be proud of. Except...
Except, she didn’t have to face Morganas back then. And she wasn’t the first submarine of the Imperial Japanese Navy to manifest a Belle.

I’m supposed to be a squadron leader, even if that... didn't work out quite as planned. To be a proper role model for submarines of the Imperial Japanese Navy - it should come naturally, shouldn’t it?
I am a representative of the Sixth Fleet to my fellow kinsmen, the other Kami of the International Protection Fleet, the Funayūrei and the rest of the world.
And the depths for me are uncharted.
That’s a lot of responsibility for your shoulders, Hachi. Especially when it’s counterintuitive for a submarine to actively want to stand out.
Well... I would be dishonest if I said I don’t wish my deeds will leave me remembered, as Dai-roku Sensuikan-sama is...
It also doesn’t help that your divine source for intuition was called into question by me, either. I’m sorry about that, Hachi.
You don’t need to apologize, Kanchou.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: In my own clumsy way, I was trying to say how much I respect your judgment - how much I think you should, too. Instead, I guess I said just the opposite.
It's just... if you were divinely inspired, then presumably I'm divinely chosen. I'm not totally comfortable with that. But I should never have-
I'm also sorry it took me so long to apologize, for that matter.
Even so, I do.
Okay.
Okay. I take it all back.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Kanchou?
I'm joking.
... Kanchou. I hate to say it, but-
Yeah, I know that look.
Look at that mess... can we tell who they're organized around? Which one is the alpha Morgana?
I think it's the Fire, Kanchou. She's a bit in the lead.
Okay. Good. We've never fought a particular lucid model of her...
@BATTLE
*whispering* Kanchou... more incoming. I haven't fully accounted for the damage we just took...
*whispering* Right. Stay submerged. Let's find out who we're dealing with.
Please... I-8, wherever you are... please... stay down. Stay away. Stay out of my sight.
Consider yourself blessed, child. You have control... so, so much control. As long as you keep yourself hidden to me... you could be anywhere.
Even now you could be out of earshot, and I’m just talking to myself.
*whispering* She’s got a point, Hachi. The first move is ours. So...
*whispering* ...For now, there’s no harm staying like this. The more we learn of her limits, the more capable the Fleet can be against her.
*whispering* As long as nobody else wanders into her line of fire. And you know the convoy schedules as well as I do...
*whispering* I’d like to try something. If you can bring my periscope to within nine meters of the surface...

Fields.MenuText: *whispering* If you’re thinking of trying what I think you’re thinking of trying - you’re sure you can pull it off?
*whispering* I’m going to assume you have backup plans for your backup plans and are willing to spend a lot of time parked down here.
*whispering* Are you crazy?

Fields.DialogueText: *whispering* If you’re thinking of what I’m thinking, I’m sure I can.
*whispering* ...I think.
*whispering* Then I think I can get you topside. I’ll give you four seconds.
*whispering* I’ll only need three, Kanchou.
*whispering* Hai.
*whispering* Then call the shots, Hachi.
*whispering* Thank you, Kanchou. Here’s my plan...
*whispering* I’m confident. I want to try this, Kanchou.
*whispering* ... Okay. Let's hope you're crazy like a fox.
Injustice considers submarines as some form of Schrödinger’s cat: alive and dead at the same time. I have no such illusions, I-8. The crossroads of life and death is suffering.
I have sent too many to stand at that crossroad already, I-8. My actions have shorn too many of their innocence and peace. I know the difference. You and your crew are very much alive.
Your bravery is unquestionable, I want you to know that. *sigh* And I know we are a threat to you. But there is a price to be paid even in the smallest of splendid little wars, child.
It is not a cost I wish to pass on to you... to anyone.
*whispering* Kanchou. Convoy... with Fleet escort.
D-do... Warn... warn... But!
*whispering* Kanchou...
*whispering* I know. Helmsman, bring Hachi to surface range, then on four, drop down half and hard to port.
*whispering* Rise to minus nine, four count then minus fifty and hard to port. Hai, Kanchou.
Too close...*sob* Get away...
*whispering* She's turning, Kanchou. About one-third into her intercept course...
*whispering* If this works, we’ll let her get closer to halfway next time. For now, commence Operation Marco Polo... mark!
Getaway... Onegotaway...
*whistles her isobue*
NOoooooo! Notgotaway! Too close! Too close I see you! Found you!
Radio status?
Warning sent, Kanchou! The convoy acknowledges!
She’s... circling back, Captain.
*whispering* Just as planned. Time to quiet down and vanish again, people.
*whispering* Descending, Kanchou. Pattern C looks best.
*whispering* Helm...
*whispering* Pattern C on your mark, Kanchou...
*whispering* Mark.
*whispering* My apologies, Kanchou. My isobue still isn't quite right.
*whispering* Don’t worry, Hachi. You know what they say: practice makes perfect.
I... I’ve lost... you? You’re still around here, I-8. I know. ...That was foolhardy and reckless... and brave.
*whispering* The chatty one. Did she somehow survive last time, or just... reincarnate?
*whispering* I recognize some of the scars, Kanchou. We made them.
*whispering* Hm.
Don’t do it again, child. I will be prepared for it next time, and find you... and catch you. Listen to me, please, and stay alive.
*whispering* Who said I would do it the same way next time? Besides, so long as you try to pursue two hares you will catch neither.
*whispering* It makes me wonder what a whole squadron of hares could do.
Hachi! Oh, Haaachi...
*whispering* Right. One of these days I'll have the sense to just turn the radio off.
How long can you stay dead before you start to rot? I wonder...
Ah, well. Perhaps another time I’ll get to speak with you, face-to-face again.
I so wanted to hear from you how you feel, Hachi. You must be so proud of your accomplishment... controlling Despair’s direction... anticipating her moves...
*tenses*
Herding her. And without firing a shot, too. Have you found all the ways to push her button yet, Hachi? Or will you continue to experiment with her... toy with her further?
We’ll have to compare notes when we meet again, Hachi. Because, of course, you aren’t anywhere near here.
Meaning the way is clear for Delusion.  She’ll feel so audacious, knowing there’s absolutely no pesky submarines in her path.
... Well, her current head will, at any rate.
... Heh heh. Perhaps you’re over that way, Hachi...
*whispering* ... She's leaving, Kanchou.
*whispering* Oh, dammit. I take it she's not close enough to engage?
*whispering* No, Kanchou. And the Delusion group we've been assigned to deal with is approaching...
*whispering* What do you want to do, Hachi?
*whispering* I want you to tell me what to do, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: *whispering* Be yourself. And right now, you’re a pesky submarine, Hachi.
*whispering* So long as you try to pursue two hares you will catch neither. Choose a hare, Hachi.
*whispering* We deal with the long-range monster now and face the long-term one later.

Fields.DialogueText: *whispering* Don’t put off for tomorrow sinking the Funayūrei you can sink today.
*whispering* You said it! Let’s show Delusion she has no idea what ‘pesky’ really means...
*whispering* ... Delusion is a threat that can’t be ignored, Kanchou.
*whispering* Hai, Kanchou.
*whispering* I agree wholeheartedly. So we still need to find her, and be prepared for an attack run when we have.
@BATTLE
"I remember ever so long/That rainy night, when all alone/I met you with your face ghastly pale/Like a spectral fire.”
It doesn’t seem that long since we ran into Injustice for the first time. Morgana mists can be as bleak as a dark and stormy night, I guess. Well, then...
*knock*
Kanchou, excuse my intrusion...
You’re fine, Hachi. Come in. I was just about to go looking for you, actually.
I got the sense that you took some of Injustice’s ranting pretty hard, Hachi. I wanted to hear your thoughts about it.
And that’s why I came to see you, Kanchou. Why do you want to know my thoughts? About what I want to do, and what I believe? What does it matter what I think and believe?
You were? Why?
I recognize that I know very little...

Fields.MenuText: And you admit it and you’re doing something about it... and I give you high marks for effort.
This is why I ask all those things. I’ve mentioned it before, but I’m not a mind-reader; it was never my intention to make you feel bad.
Nonsense. You know a great deal, and you’re learning fast.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Even if a Funayūrei gets the better of me?
You, me, other Morganas. Hachi, where Injustice is concerned, you’re definitely not the only one.
I know that, Kanchou.
... I see.
Let me ask you: if you do happen to compare notes with Injustice, can you tell her what the difference is between you two? I can: sincerity. How does the Imperial Rescript put it again...?
"These five articles are the soul of Our soldiers and sailors, and sincerity is the soul of these articles.
"If the heart be not sincere, words and deeds, however good, are all mere outward show and can avail nothing. If only the heart be sincere, anything can be accomplished."
There you go. Injustice may set you up to take advantage of other Morgana, but she is no ally. And I have no doubt if Despair - chatty Despair - caught us in her sights, she’d kill us...
But her heart wouldn’t be in it.
Just as yours wasn’t when you found out. Because your heart is sincere, you accomplished the impossible: you protected a convoy, yourself and your enemy and not a shot was fired.
Well done, Hachi.
Oh!
Captain requested to the bridge!
There’s an incoming message.
What is it?
I didn't catch it, Kanchou. There's a translator working on it now, I think.
Then it should be ready when I get there. I'll see you later...
What’s this? Kanchou’s bookmark has already moved...?
“As the moon sinks on the mountain-edge / The fishermen's lights flicker / Far out on the dark wide sea.
“When we think that we alone / Are steering our ships at midnight / We hear the splash of oars / Far beyond us.”
... Kanchou...
"I will tread the sharpness of the/double-edged sword/And die with a good heart/If it be for your sake."
@BATTLE
You look deep in thought.
Ah, Kanchou. I can’t decide between the Forty-Seven Faithful or Dai-Nankō’s Loyalty.
And you’re deciding because...?
Ryūjin and the dutiful ship, Sensuitei Dai-roku: the Submersible who became a Submarine.
Ah. Your chances to see plays lately have been few and far between...
Indeed. Hutchinson-san may have a hidden talent as a kamishibai performer, but she’s no artist.
Fortunately, there are one or two members of the crew who know bosses. They’re trying to arrange stories to be mailed out to us.

Fields.MenuText: Aren’t professional story boards a bit much for Hutchinson’s cardboard box-level stage frame?
I hope Hutchinson knows about all this...
And of course the tradition of purchasing snacks to support the kamishibaya will continue...

Fields.DialogueText: Maintenance already has ideas for a proper butai.
She’s the reason why I have to decide. “As a paper play to entertain the spirit of the ship, it only makes sense for the kami to choose the kamishibai.”
I suppose that’s one way for an Enlisted Liaison to a vessel’s Kami to maintain dialogue with her Belle.
Well... the cooks insisted...
If it works out, can I make a subject request?
You have but to ask, Kanchou! What particular stories would you like to see?
Some light comedies would be good. Maybe some traditional stories with funayūrei, too.
Funayūrei?
Sure, why not? Unless Belle ships have just been keeping a low profile until now, regular sailors have been on their own in encounters with them in the past.
A few folk tales where people who didn’t have deck guns or torpedoes still live to tell about it can’t hurt.
That’s true. Funayūrei in tales don’t need weapons to defeat them though; just the dipper or bailing bucket that she wants... with a hole in it.
Most Morganas aren’t very talkative.
No. And I suspect the Funayūrei I sense nearby is no different.
@BATTLE
What’s this? For me?
It’s a dipper with no bottom - and since you aren’t a funayūrei, no, it’s not for you. It’s for any Morgana that asks for one, just in case.
I see. That’s good, because I have just detected one...
@BATTLE
I guess she wasn’t a traditionalist.
I suppose not. Either that, or now that you have a hishaku to give when asked, you’ve ensured no Funayūrei will ever demand one.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah. Or now we’ll meet the one who demands we do a tea ceremony, and we’ll have no functional dipper for water.
Probably.
I wonder if our engineers have enough scrap pipe to make a metal one - that way we can beat the non-traditionalists over the head with it.

Fields.DialogueText: In that case, given that I’m not versed in chadō, malfunctioning tools would probably the least of our worries, Kanchou.
I guess I will have to face them the traditional way for me: with torpedoes and shells.
It would take too much effort to make something so corse aesthetically pleasing...and durable. I probably would only get one or two uses out of it before I’d need a replacement.
It's good to see you in better spirits, Hachi.
... You think so?
I do... and I’m glad.
She left her bookmark in the front. I wonder what that means.
*sigh* Look at the time. Poor Kanchou - you said your meeting was going to go long, but it's even worse than you thought.
Shikata ga nai. While I wait, maybe I can find a poem to share...
"Though you say, 'Do not grieve!'/I know not, alas/When we shall meet again/How can I but pine after you?"
"Should the time come/When the names of heaven and earth perish/Then, then alone we should cease to meet!"
*flips pages*
*flips pages*
"In the autumn mountains/The yellow leaves are so thick/Alas, how shall I seek my love/Who has wandered away?/I know not the mountain track."
I never realized before just how many poems in the collection speak on the longing for another.
The loss of being left behind when one’s Sovereign ascends to the heavens... Filial-longing by soldiers, when duty separates them from their parents...
The desire to see a loved... one?
*FROM THE CORRIDOR OUTSIDE*
It's fine, Ensign! It's not a problem unless it catches fire a second time, okay?
*gasps*
Hachi? Sorry, that took longer than I expected.
... Hachi?

Fields.MenuText: Really, Hachi. I’m really, really really sorry. And did I mention I’m sorry?
I wonder if the Manyōshū has an apology poem...
Can you forgive me a little quicker than last time? Please??

Fields.DialogueText: There's a volume out - I guess she was here for a while. Let’s see...
